titles.title: Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" / Täʾamrä Giyorgis "Miracles of George"

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" (fols. 4ra-77vb) I-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 4ra-8ra) I-2) Introductive exhortation and hymns (fols. 8ra-10va) I-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki ... "I worship Thee ..." (fols. 10va-12rb) I-4) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 90 miracles (fols. 12ra-77vb) II) Täʾamrä Giyorgis "Miracles of George": 14 miracles (fols. 78ra-100rb)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: Several persons are mentioned in supplication formulas: Wäldä ʾEwosṭatewos (fols. 8rb, 69ra, 70ra), Wäldä Krǝstos (fols. 9va, 77ra), Sǝnä Qal (fol. 77ra), Gädlä Sämaʿt (fols. 13rb, 14rb, 22va, 54vb, 60ra, 63vab, 97vb, 100rab).

dcomments.dcomment: King ʾIyasu mentioned on fol. 8rb might refer to King ʾIyasu II (r. 1730-55).

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is worn. The front board is broken and repaired. The leather cover on both boards is partly torn off. The Ms. was resewn; the original sewing is missing. Holes or tears carefully amended on fols. 22, 31, 32, 41.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board broken and repaired) covered with untooled dark brown leather. Overback made of dark reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the dark reddish-brown overback (2 tools were used: double line fillet and double circle).

squires.squire:
I(11/fols. 1r-11v) – II(8/fol. 12r-19v) – III(8/fols. 20r-27v) – IV(8/fols. 28r-35v) – V(8/fols. 36r-43v) – VI(8/fols. 44r-51v) – VII(8/fols. 52r-59v) – VIII(8/fols. 60r-67v) – IX(8/fols. 68r-77v) – X(8/fols. 78r-85v) – XI(8/fols. 86r-93v) – XII(10/fols. 94r-101v).
The structure of quire I and II cannot be identified as most of the leaves have been crudely sewn together along the spinefolds.

taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling (occasionally below the ruling: fols. 90r-v, 92r-v).
The scribe sometimes did not use the bottom ruled line (fols. 4r-5r, 8r-11v-72r-73v, 96r-97v).

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The script appears uneven, tending to rounded and right-sloping letters.

rubrications.rubrication: Names of the protagonists; name of King ʾIyasu (fol. 8rb); names of the donors; a few lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-4 and II, incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections of Text I and its numbers; the words sälam "salutation" in Text I-3 and Marpigis (place name) on fol. 81va; directives for the ministers in Text I-3; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: In Text I-7: ይካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡

otherdetails.otherdetail:
All miracles are numbered.
Text I-2 includes the hymns: - ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl bä-kǝlʾe Maryam wäladitä ʾamlak ... "O my Lady, Holy Two-fold Virgin Mary, Godbearing ..." (fol. 9rb-9va l.16) - ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Maryam Mariham ʾǝmmu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos kähali ... "O my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ the Almighty ..." (fol. 9va l.16-vb l.14)(cp. ChRep no. 373) - Sälam läki ʾo-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Maryam ʾǝmmä mädḫǝn wä-ʾǝmmä bǝrhan ... "Salutation to you, o my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light ..." (fols. 9vb l.14-10va)
Text I-3 contains: - Ṣälotä zä-yǝtbähal ʾǝmqǝdmä yanbǝbu täʾamriha lä-ʾәgzǝʾt kwәllәnä ... "Prayer recited before reading the Miracles of our Lady ..." (fols. 11rb-12ra) - Excerpt from the Gospel of John (Jn. 19:25-27) (fol. 12ra-rb).

additional.cont: Fol. 3ra-va: Miracle of St. Michael.
additional.det: The incipit and the names of St. Michael and St. George are rubricated. The name in the concluding supplication is barely legible (Gäbrä ʾAmlak?).

extras.extra: - The scribe has reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the end of the column: fols. 12rb, 78vb. - Corrections are written over erasure: e.g., fols. 5ra, 14vb, 22va, 35ra, 52rab, 58rq, 73vb, 84vb. - Erasures are indicated by series of dashes or by thin parallel lines: e.g., fols. 8vb, 58ra, 88rb.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - The numbers of all miracles are repeated in small script in the outer margin or inter-column: from fol. 20v onwards.

miniature.details: Six miniatures originating from a different codex have been sewn onto fol. 101r. The size of each miniature is approx. 6/6.5x7 (Width) x (Heigth). Miniature 1: Fol.101r: St. George slaying the dragon. Legend: ጊዮርጊስ ፡ "George". Miniature 2: Fol.101r: The Virgin and Child. Legend: ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ "With her beloved Son". Miniature 3: Fol.101r: Two Saints. Legend: [n.l.] አቡነ፡ ኪሮስ "ʾAbunä Kiros". Miniature 4: Fol.101r: St. Theodore the Anatolian (?) Legend: [n.l.] ቴዎድሮስ፡ ዘከመ፡ ጼወዎ፡ ለኒጎሚዶስ፡ "How Theodore captured Nicomedes." Miniature 5: Fol.101r: Covenant of Mercy . Legend: The Legend is barely legible: ዘከመ፡ ወሀባ... "How he gave her..." Miniature 6: Fol.101r: St. Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus. Legend: ተማኅፀነ፡ ቀፀላ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ በማርያም፡ ወበጊዮርጊስ፡ ወበአቡነ፡ ገብረ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ "Qäḍäla Giyorgis entrusted himself to Mary and to George and to ʾabunä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus".

drawing.info: Fol.100vr: St. George slaying the dragon.
